result.execSummary:
The defendant Dashawn D Buford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random drug and/or alcohol screens and pay for the same. 

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process including but not limited to anger management and domestic abuse counseling. 

No contact with L.M.M. DOB: 02-21-2000 unless permitted by the agent.
Seek and maintain fulltime occupation of some kind (work, school, treatment, etc.) with the agent's approval.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on March 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:40 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Dashawn D Buford appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Dashawn D Buford. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Scheduling conference on May 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Further proceedings on April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on March 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter from defendant requesting bail modification.

2:49 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Dashawn D Buford appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Luke Harrison appearing with the defendant.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Bail is set at $1,000.00  recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with L.M.N., DOB: 02-21-2000 or any premises she occupies. Bail furnished.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

RE:  Felony bail jumping-dvo, on 02-11-22.
Initial appearance is set for 02-21-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2
